translated: If good men and good women are able to listen to, uphold, read, recite, diligently practice, contemplate according to the meaning, copy, explain, and widely disseminate this profound prajñā-pāramitā, these good men and good women will always have peace and joy in their bodies and minds, and will not be harmed by any disasters or misfortunes.

original: 「復次，憍尸迦！
analyzed: 「復次，憍尸迦！

translated: If good men and good women receive and uphold, read and recite, draw near to make offerings, contemplate according to the meaning, write out, explain, and widely disseminate this perfection of wisdom, then these good men and good women, if they encounter an army in battle, will sincerely recite this perfection of wisdom. It is impossible for them to lose their lives in the army.

original: 何以故？

original: 憍尸迦！

original: 「復次，憍尸迦！
analyzed: 「復次，憍尸迦！

translated: If good men and good women do not separate from the mind of omniscience, using non-apprehension as a skillful means, always sincerely listening to, respectfully making offerings to, venerating, praising, upholding, reciting, contemplating according to the meaning, diligently practicing, copying, explaining, and widely circulating such profound prajñā-pāramitā, then all poisons, evil spells, ghosts, spirits, curses, and spells will not be able to harm these good men and good women. original: 何以故？
